Dead By Daylight or DBD is game that is very hard to be balanced.At one point the game was blowing and everyone played it,recored videos,streamed and e.t.c.Now the game has still a pretty good player base even though no big youtubers like h20,Ohm or Vanoss play it.DBD has huge youtubers that play it like ochido,no0b3,monto and e.t.c.But with every new update comes new bugs or glitches or even more hate to the game.I will recomend the game but buy it with friends bcs sometimes your team is just doesn't care about you and your teamates.I will give this game positive rewiew bcs i like like it and i want to see it grow.

Questo gioco è molto bello sotto alcuni aspetti... Mette ansia, devi completare obiettivi per scappare nel frattempo che un killer ti cerca per ucciderti. Il concept è un'idea con moltissimi pro ma in gioco non è iniettata bene. Inanzitutto il Killer è molto avvantaggiato rispetto ai sopravvisuti e inolte gli sviluppatori non risolvono bug ma pensano ad aggiungere contenuti e a creare eventi(che vanno a creare bug su altri bug[C'E' UN GIOCO IN QUESTO BUG]). La Grafica è ben sviluppata e gli altri meccanismi che fanno "funzionare" il gioco sono ben implementati ma del resto... Niente di bello. Inoltre dopo l'ultima patch (1.9.4), hanno aggiunto il sistema degli emblemi che ha reso ancora più difficile il compito di salire di rank... è quasi impossibile fare un pip e inoltre i giocatori che distraggono il killer e non si concentrano sui generatori però creando l'opportunità agli altri rimasti di finire gli obiettivi e scappare... invece di salire per il loro duro lavoro vengo penalizzati perchè non SEGUONO, le cose che gli sviluppatori dicono di fare... Io ci gioco da tantissimo tempo a questo gioco... sul mio profilo compaiono solo 30 ore e qualcosa ma su un altro profilo ne ho 400+ ore! Se gli sviluppatori non fanno qualcosa per questi problemi, questo gioco è in via di estizione
这个游戏真心不错，推荐大家都来玩玩。

UPDATED: 8 March 2020. See bottom for that.

This review is SURVIVOR biased. My time on this game was 90% survivor and 10% killer

I have invested a lot of time into this game. And a lot of it I've done on stream as display to others. Now i'll start with the good. This game is LOADS of fun with friends and coordinating with them gives you the sensation that you are truly in this game for survival. The dev's routinely adding DLC to diversify the game well enough to where it doesn't appear stale which is also good. And while playing alone the first few times you will get that horror feeling of feeling clueless and hopeless much like its intended to. 

Now the bad, the bad comes in when you've invested some decent time into this game (such as myself) and that's when the issue start coming through the cracks. First and foremost, this games connection issues are atrocious, killers with pings up in the 1,000s should not be allowed to play killer, its ridiculous because they control every aspect of the game and YOU as the survivor are to feel pain for it because he experiences no issues while you take 3 extra seconds to drop a pallete or jump over a window. Tunneling by killers is also a bad issues, if you as the survivor are doing well to stay away from the killer this is seen as a toxic action and the killer makes it their goal in life to make sure you don't get away and earn no points through the rest of the game, and if you add on an bad connection issue and possible puppy guarding or "face camping" you'll find yourself just wanting to put your head through a wall. 

Another issue is no safety against a poor connection, if you connect to a game using a higher end offering or add on. And the killer DCs halfway through loading or right as the game starts. Those offering or add ons? Yea they're gone. You're not getting those back. Using them is a gamble before the game even starts

Which now segways into the next noticeable issue, the community. It's HORRIBLY toxic, to the point where even if you feel you play 100% correctly you'll upset someone regardless. But the issue is this, since everything is seen as toxic, the common reaction is for the killer or survivor to play toxic in response. Who has fun when that happens? No one. Not even the people who aren't in that situation. The other issue is unsportsmanlike conduct on survivors and how it severely ***** over their team. Imagine this, game starts right? Within 1 minute your teammate is down and in the process of being shouldered to be carried to a hook to start the sacrifice process. Well instead they DC, leaving the now 3 survivors to deal with 5 generators to repair and a now ****** off killer since he cant get more points now either. You ever repair 5 generators with 3 survivors? Yea no you're not, the odds are LARGELY stacked against you. Which will lead him to likely camp whoever he finds first because at that point securing kills is the smarter thing to do. And again post game it'll be nothing but toxicity being thrown back and forth which sucks all the fun away from it. Playing it at that point feels more like a chore than an enjoyable experience.

Another issue, coding. The game feels unpolished or basically unfinished at times. There are plenty of time a killer should NOT be able to hit you but since you haven't fully completed the animation of jumping out of a window or hoping a pallete you still get hit. While you probably matched with a guy with a MINIMUM 400+ ping so you took extra time to vault and he still rushed and smacked you. 

The new ranking system is just awful much like everyone else says. The worst are people who purposely de rank themselves to play with casuals and inexperienced players for free points, so you'll get demolished by a rank "20" leatherface or trapper who's prestiged at least once or twice. If you have prestiged you should not be able to play with lower ranking folks, you CLEARLY know what you're doing with that character. And the medals make the game even more toxic at times, resulting in MORE fighting.

This was one of my favorite games, truly it was. But everything the dev's do with adding DLC but not fixing BASIC coding issues shows they just want to make more money and not fix their product which was arguably better when it first came out. 

Edit: Now with a few hundred more hours under my belt

Well, they have done a lot of quality of life improvements, like the party system thank god. But on the whole my only issue largely comes with killers still being favored in perks and gameplay. They seem to be getting stronger and better with each update. The deck still seems largely stacked against survivors even still. Maybe that's what they are going for? Don't know but I wish the game wasn't largely so biased to the Killers. My favorite example is stacking no-ed on top of the new end game system? Yea you're not getting out if you're seen and the killer is remotely competent. Killers get crutches, Survivors are told to get better. That's just how I see it. The game is still fun with friends, and connection issues seem to be far less frequent. The new charm system is kinda cool? It's there? It's something. All aesthetics and adds some life and personalization to the game so that's noteworthy. But again this is all my opinion, granted a lot of it is based on how people play and not guaranteed factors that WILL happen. But hey that's what reviews are for. But I will recommend the game now for the fun factor if you're just looking for a good product worth $20. This game is there

Убогая система повышения рейтинга за маньяка: игра поощряет гнусные способы победы вроде: кемпинга и фокусировании на одном противнике, что ведёт к проигрышу исключительно одного, к несчастью, выбранного убийцей, выжившего. При этом за честную игру маньяк теряет свой ранг и вынужден либо менять свой стиль игры на ублюдский, либо смириться со своей позицией в рейтинге, так как поднять его честными способами не представляется возможным. (всё выше сказанное не касается маньяков играющих с кучей аддонов или на медсестре, у них всё хорошо).

Bought the game on Steam.  Played most of my hours on Xbox One.  Tonight I've uninstalled the game and strongly suggest anyone else thinking of playing to do the same.

I play killer exclusively.  The game is rigged against killers.  You'll have a good time at first but you'll finally reach the point where the following things will happen:

1. As soon as you grab a survivior, they disconnect.  Other survivors follow.  You lose your add-ons and don't get compensated for them.

2. Survivors are suffering from a warping bug... where they jump between 5 and 10 feet every few seconds.  Makes it impossible to hit them.

3. Lunge attacks become untenable.  You can be right on top of a survivor, lunge attack them, and totally miss repeatedly in one match.  In another?  Hitting as expected.  Obvious bug.

4. A coordinated group of survivors will trigger multiple generators within the first two minutes of the game.  You can do nothing to stop them.

5. When chasing a survivor, they simply turn in a few circles and vanish.  Good luck finding them.  Extra problems if you're on the farm levels... the fucking corn is a mess.

6. If you hook a survivor and don't face camp them then they'll be saved by others.  Yay.  If you do camp them then you're subject to ridicule and verbal attack.  Lose / lose.

7. Numerous bugs when occur when you're attacking survivors in various situtaions.  One of my favorites being when attacking a survivor being unhooked by another, it's 75% guaranteed to hit the one being unhooked and causing no damage whatsoever.  Second favorite?  Getting stuck in a pallet and being unable to move until the next match.

Is it worth $20?  Sure.  But is it worth your gaming time?  No way.  This game could be so much more.  But, instead, it's been coded by amateurs that don't give one iota about your time or money spent.

Gonna go spend my time playing games not plagued with bugs and ridiculous issues.

Overall, I like DBD more than I dislike it.

The game is still working on balance but it is fun overall.

Pros:
- Fun multiplayer options with your friends. You can play with friends as all survivors in survive with friends or play the sandbox mode in kill your friends. In kill your friends, everything is unlocked for you but you don't earn any blood points or shards in this mode. 

- There is a lot of variety in the survivors and the killers. You can pick and choose your playstyle which is nice. There are 3 "teachable" perks for every survivor and once you get to a high enough level with that survivor, if you obtain the teachable perk, it will start appearing in other survivors webs. This means you can match your playstyle with other characters with enough time.

- You can also pick your aesthetic as well to a limited degree. As described above, each survivor has their own set of unique perks that can become teachable later on so you can get your favorite perks on your favorite survivor. The outfits are also kind of nice. You can purchase some but also get them through prestiging (when you hit level 50, you can keep unlocking new bloodwebs for new items/offerings/perks OR you can prestige and reset a survivor to level 1 and open up new outfits and also increase the chances of getting better items/offerings/perks on that prestiged survivor's bloodweb)

- There is a thing called the shrine and with enough shards (a currency you earn by playing the game) you can buy perks before unlocking them on each survivor's web. This is just a time shortcut so that you don't have to play the game for ages before getting your ideal combination of perks and looks.

Cons:
- Balance issues. Certain combinations of perks, items, and offerings are really overpowered.

After about 60 hours in this game, I can definitely say that for the price this game is amazing and I don't see myself stopping any time soon.
PROS: 
-It's actually scary, I still scream from time to time
-Emphasizes teamwork, even if you can't directly communicate with your team mates
-No lootboxes or pay to win mechanics
-Perks offer an edge but rarely feel unfair (with the exception of a select few) and are a good incentive to keep playing
-Playing survivor and playing killer feel like completely different games, each with their own unique goals
-Game is still getting DLC/Expansions and has an active community
-Fantastic Co-op
CONS: 
-P2P Connection where the killer is the host. Sometimes they can just disconnect from a game if they're doing poorly, although this doesn't happen too frequently
-Survivors who use very rare flashlights and then disconnect from the game before they die so they don't lose said item can be super frustrating for the killer
-Latency issues occasionally where you'll think you cleared a vault only to have the killer hit you from the complete other side, this is again based on the host's (killer's) connection

For $19.99 this game is absolutely worth it, ESPECIALLY if you have some friends to play it with. Being in comms with 3 other friends playing against a killer who knows what they're doing is an awesome experience that you won't find in any other game.

Whelp. It looks like it's that time again. 
Either the steam sale is upon us or you've found yourself looking for something new.

You're asking yourself that question yet again.
"Should I buy this game?"

Unfortunately, it's not as simple as yes or no, but I'll cut through the fancy talk and hit you with some questions of my own.

Are you a competitive person?
Do you typically play with friends but have times when you just want to play by yourself?
Do you like bullying or getting bullied?
Are you fond of abusing game design?
Did you play Evolve before it [strike] died [/strike] became free to play?

If you answered 'yes' to one or more of these questions, then you might enjoy Dead by Daylight.

That said, here's my take: Like any game, Dead by Daylight isn't for everyone. If you rage or get stressed out easily, then consider not picking the game up. But, if you're a masochist or a sadist, then this might be the game for you. There's loads of room to bully or get bullied, on either side of the community.

Regardless what anyone says, the game has plenty of depth and anything can work if you're skilled [spoiler] or your opponents are shit [/spoiler]. But, unfortunately, there's a pretty dominant meta when it comes to player loadouts. As with any competitive game, certain loadouts are just outright better than others. Also, being a competitive game, people can be toxic. Either intentionally (for laughs) or because they have brain damage. That's just the nature of the beast when it comes to this type of game.

Jokes aside, Dead by Daylight is a fun game once you understand the intricacies of how to play it and how to combat certain play styles. Additionally, it's a good party game for five to six people. There's a private lobby system that allows a group to test out features of the game or to just simply play against each other.

At the end of the day, it comes down to you. If you're truly interested in buying the game, evidenced by taking the time to get this far in one of my reviews, then look into some videos or watch some streams.
Or you can just be impulsive and add the game to your ever-growing library of games you don't touch. [i] We've all been there, don't lie. [/i]

If you've read all of this review, thank you for taking the time to do so.

J'aime bien quand : les joueurs jouent en équipe, font les générateurs, me fassent rire ou inversement, incarne le beau Dwight ou le magnifique Jeff, arrivent avant de passer en deuxième phase sur le crochet moisie.

Je n'aime pas : les joueurs toxic, les gens qui trollent, les tueurs qui te focus why ? Les survivants qui ne comprennent pas le jeu et te laissent mourir comme une feuille d'automne. Les tueurs de mauvaises foi ( rager ce n'est pas bien), les gens qui t'insultes les meilleurs le respect il n'y en a presque pas. 

Bref, il y a une grosse liste. 

Maintenant venant au jeu, il y a énormément de bug comme une seconde mon jeu se fige et continue comme si de rien n'était entre temps je peux mourir, ou rater un QTE ou super le jeu crash en pleine partie. Le lobby est cassé soit ça prend quelques secondes ou maxi 30 minutes pour trouver une partie. Sérieusement ? Tout ce temps pour se faire tuer en deux secondes, ou le tueur quitte et recommencer une recherche.  Plus ils font des maj, plus le jeu devient anarchique avec les bugs. Fixez votre jeu et continuez la nouveauté après. Enfin bref, j'aime beaucoup ce jeu juste la communauté qui craint par moment et le jeu. Voili voilà :3

Dead by Daylight is a fun and addicting horror game, the game itself isnt a problem and if you play with friends the game only gets a lot more fun. My only issue is the toxicity in the community. I primarily play survivor but i get very annoyed when people talk about camping and how its "unfair" or such. If you are looking at it unbiasedly then you should know that it is perfectly fair, as they camp the survivors could finish the entire trial before the person finally dies. It is 100% a strategy and could backfire if you choose to continue to do your objectives. The characters and traits are pretty well made and to get the better abilities you need to play the game more. There are in game purchases but you do not need them to be the best. All you need to be good is practice and that is a great aspect of the game.
怎么说呢，作为刚接触这游戏没多久的萌新，我觉得这游戏可能对萌新有点不太友好，因为当我第一次玩游戏时除了文字讲解外没有任何实际的教程(我相信很多人会和我一样玩游戏时看的静下心去读文字)，导致刚开始玩难免有些摸不着头脑，还有一个就是人类和杀手之间有些不平衡导致有时游戏体验极差，不过总体来说这游戏还是很好的，价格也很合适。

ai você vai perguntar '' Madruga''você jogou tanto porque não recomendou?''

[b]Jogabilidade[/b]

- Survivor: ser sobrevivente nesse jogo vem se tornando cada vez mais agradavel, pois

[b]Sobre a Gameplay...[/b]

ah... disso é dificil de falar.. 5 gerados, 4 sobreviventes, 1 killer.. milhares de problemas.. ainda bugado em varios momentos.. existem lugares em que o sobrevivente fica que o killer não acerta, Ochido mostrou varios desses..
hora que a conexão do host, o killer fica uma merd.. acaba com a gameplay todinha..e o problema de perder save ainda assombra esse jogo. Eles lançam muitos paths de correção mas eles correm muito atras de lançar DLC meus caros.. baratas pra enganar vc e te fazer comprar..

Não tente carregar seu save antigo como eles dizem, você será banido, não corra atras de conquistas q eles acham impossivel em determinado tempo, voce sera banido..

Mas porque realmente negativei Dead bu Daylight?.. 

POR SUA CAUSA!! você que é chato e tóxico , que entra no chat e não consegue dizer ''gg'' e fica chamando, se for ruim - ah é noob, lixo. Filho disso , filho daquilo.. se joga bem - é hacker, modder, ta de Wall hacker.. bando de PNC.. vocês estragam o jogo por serem chatos e chorões.. o pior que ainda vai no perfil chingar o cara lá ha.. pois é.. DBD é um jogo com um tema interessante mas muita coisa devia mudar.. só que não vai..

这个游戏对萌新很不友好，没有教程，只能完全去自己摸索，有的仅仅只有文字教程，而且往往萌新玩屠夫会有等好久才匹配到人的情况，然后还不一定抓得到，我希望杀机自定义里面可以加入人机就好了我就可以用人机练练屠夫了（笑）

살인마밸런스 엉망,  버그 투성이, 매칭시간도 길고 핑 좋은방 찾기도 힘듦
무한로딩 버그 걸리면 게임 끄고 다시켜서 매칭잡아야 하는데 또 무한로딩 걸리면 진짜 겜하기 싫어짐
핵쟁이들도 진짜많음 거의 글옵과 유사함 지이이이이인짜 많음
매월 13일은 뉴비들 죽어가는날 랭크시스템 엉망
Eine gute Wahl für alle, die gerne viel Zeit in ein Spiel investieren.
